docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday declared unconstitutional the state’s ultrasound requirement for women seeking abortions, saying it violated the First Amendment by requiring doctors to display a fetal image and describe it even to women who covered their eyes and ears.

headline.main: North Carolina: Judge Blocks Ultrasound Requirement
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Judge Blocks Ultrasound Requirement

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Catherine C Eagles declares unconstitutional North Carolina's ultrasound requirement for women seeking abortions; says it violates the First Amendment by requiring doctors to display a fetal image and describe it even to women who covered their eyes and ears

docs.lead_paragraph: “Devil’s Due” centers on a couple who discover they’re expecting a baby after a honeymoon outing that they can’t fully recall. Hmm.

docs.lead_paragraph: The country could be the first European Union member to retreat on reproductive rights.
docs.snippet: The country could be the first European Union member to retreat on reproductive rights.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday struck down a 2011 North Carolina law requiring abortion providers to perform an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before having an abortion, arguing it violated the constitutional right to free speech of doctors.

headline.main: North Carolina Ultrasound Abortion Law Ruled Illegal by Judge
headline.print_headline: North Carolina Ultrasound Abortion Law Ruled Illegal by Judge

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Friday struck down a 2011 North Carolina law requiring abortion providers to perform an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before having an abortion, arguing it violated the constitutional right to free speech of doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Jan. 17 about a court ruling on North Carolina's 2011 abortion law, The Associated Press reported erroneously in the headlines what the judge found unconstitutional. U.S. District Judge Catherine Eagles invalidated requiring an abortion provider to describe to the patient what is displayed on an accompanying ultrasound. The story also erroneously described state Rep. Paul Stam, R-Wake, as the House majority leader.
docs.snippet: In a story Jan. 17 about a court ruling on North Carolina's 2011 abortion law, The Associated Press reported erroneously in the headlines what the judge found unconstitutional. U.S. District Judge Catherine Eagles invalidated requiring an abortion...

docs.lead_paragraph: One in 13 children could see their lives shortened by smoking unless the nation takes more aggressive action to end the tobacco epidemic, the U.S. Surgeon General said Friday — even as, astonishingly, scientists added still more diseases to the long list of cigarettes' harms.

headline.main: Surgeon General Urges New Resolve to End Smoking
headline.print_headline: Surgeon General Urges New Resolve to End Smoking

docs.lead_paragraph: Long known to cause lung cancer and heart disease, smoking also causes diabetes, colorectal and liver cancers and erectile dysfunction, a new report from the United States surgeon general says.

headline.main: List of Smoking-Related Illnesses Grows Significantly in U.S. Report
headline.print_headline: List of Smoking-Related Illnesses Grows Significantly in U.S. Report

docs.abstract: Report by acting surgeon general Dr Boris D Lushniak says cigarette smoking--long known to cause lung cancer and heart disease--also causes diabetes, colorectal and liver cancers, erectile dysfunction and ectopic pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Long known to cause lung cancer and heart disease, smoking also causes diabetes, colorectal and liver cancers and erectile dysfunction, a new report from the United States surgeon general says.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 22-year-old woman who tried to give her newborn to authorities by pretending to find the baby on a Hawaii beach kept her pregnancy a secret because she didn't want to disappoint her family, her attorney said.

headline.main: Honolulu Mom Who Lied About Baby Is Sentenced
headline.print_headline: Honolulu Mom Who Lied About Baby Is Sentenced

docs.snippet: A 22-year-old woman who tried to give her newborn to authorities by pretending to find the baby on a Hawaii beach kept her pregnancy a secret because she didn't want to disappoint her family, her attorney said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kansas Gov. Sam Brownback compared past "Summer of Mercy" anti-abortion protests in Wichita to the abolitionist movement that helped end slavery in a major speech Wednesday night.

headline.main: Kansas Governor Praises 'Summer of Mercy' Protests
headline.print_headline: Kansas Governor Praises 'Summer of Mercy' Protests
